attributes.action: legally enforce the traffic-light system of nutritional advice on all food products
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Various food producers (usually convenience foods) and certain supermarket chains (eg Tesco) have ignored the traffic light system recommended by public health watchdogs and instituted a more complicated syatem.  These producers have also funded a TV ad campaign to "educate" the general public about the benefits of their labelling system, implying that these labels present more information, allowing the consumer to make a well-formed decision.  The red-amber-green system allows you to compare products at a glance and adhesion to this recommendation should NOT BE VOLANTARY.
